[[wikipedia:ZX Spectrum|ZX-Spectrum]] | releasedate=[[1982]] | genre=[[wikipedia:Role-playing games|RPG]], [[wikipedia:Interactive fiction|Text-Adventure]] |}} :''Not to be confused with the MUD [[The Dungeons of Moria (video game)]]'' '''Moria''' is an illustrated, role-playing text-adventure video game set in [[Moria]].{{webcite|author=Fredrik Ekman|articleurl=http://www.faqs.org/faqs/tolkien/games/|articlename=List of computer games and MUDs with a Tolkien theme (long)|dated=|website=[http://www.faqs.org faqs.org]|accessed=16 august 2010}} The objective of the game is to find [[Ring of Thrór|Durin's Ring]]. Although commercial, it was not licensed by the [[Tolkien Estate]] or the [[Middle-earth Enterprises|Tolkien Enterprises]]. ==See also== * [[The Dungeons of Moria (video game)|The Dungeons of Moria]], another RPG set in Moria ==External links== * [http://www.lysator.liu.se/tolkien-games/entry/moria.html Moria] at [http://www.lysator.liu.se Tolkien Games] {{references}} {{title|italics}} [[Category:Commodore 64 games]] [[Category:Oric-1 games]] [[Category:Role-playing video games]] [[Category:Text-Adventure video games]] [[Category:ZX Spectrum games]]
